original: rab gsal ba 'od gsal ba'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: rab gsal ba 'od gsal ba'i rang bzhin no //
translated: The clear light is the nature of clear light.

original: gang du zhe na /
analyzed: gang du zhe na /

analyzed: rang gi dkyil 'khor rang rig pa'i ye shes su de rnams cho ga bzhin sbyin par bya ste /
translated: In one's own mandala, in the gnosis of self-awareness, one should perform the rite.

original: rang rig pa'i ye shes gang la cho ga bsgrub pa'i bya ba de yod pa'i ye @182a * //
analyzed: rang rig pa'i ye shes gang la cho ga bsgrub pa'i bya ba de yod pa'i ye @182a * //

analyzed: shes de ni cho ga dang ldan pa'o //

analyzed: 'dis ni lha'i rnam par dag pa ste de rab tu gsal ba'i mtshan nyid kyis rang bzhin rnam par dag pa'o //

analyzed: cho ga bzhin zhes pa 'dis lha'i rnam par dag pa ste /

original: gnyis ka yongs su dag pa'i dbang bskur ba sbyin zhing spang bar bya ste /
analyzed: gnyis ka yongs su dag pa'i dbang bskur ba sbyin zhing spang bar bya ste /

original: mchod dang gsol ba gdab pa nyid //

original: ji ltar bshad pa de bzhin 'dir //
analyzed: ji ltar bshad pa de bzhin 'dir //

analyzed: zhes pa ji ltar dbang bskur ba'i le'ur kun rdzob dang don dam pa dbyer med pa'i mchod pa dang gsol ba gdab pa gsungs pa de bzhin du 'dir yang ste ;

original: bsam gtan gyis mngon sum du rang gi snying gar rang gi sa bon las 'thon pa'i 'od zer nag po lcags kyu'i rnam pas khams gsum na bzhugs pa'i sangs rgyas thams cad spyan drangs nas ma mo brgyad kyis yang dag par mchod nas gsol ba gdab par bya'o
analyzed: bsam gtan gyis mngon sum du rang gi snying gar rang gi sa bon las 'thon pa'i 'od zer nag po lcags kyu'i rnam pas khams gsum na bzhugs pa'i sangs rgyas thams cad spyan drangs nas ma mo brgyad kyis yang dag par mchod nas gsol ba gdab par bya'o
translated: By means of meditative stabilization, one should invite all the Buddhas residing in the three realms with black light rays in the form of hooks, which emanate from one's seed syllable in one's heart. Having made perfect offering with the eight mother goddesses, one should supplicate.

original: // aa bhi shinytsa tu m'am sarba ta th'a ga ta /üîΩzhes pa ste /
analyzed: // aa bhi shinytsa tu m'am sarba ta th'a ga ta / zhes pa ste /

original: de'i rjes la /
analyzed: de'i rjes la /

analyzed: bden pa gnyis kyi bdag nyid kyi phyir bzang po'o //

original: de ci zhe na /
analyzed: de ci zhe na /

original: gsungs @182b pa ;
analyzed: gsungs @182b pa ;

analyzed: 'dis ni phyogs bcu'i 'khrul pa yang gnyis su med pa rtog pas zos par gyur to zhes pa'o //

analyzed: nang gi rim par gnas pa'i mkha' 'gro ma bzhi bdag med ma dang lnga ste /

original: de yang drug pa rdo rje 'chang /
analyzed: de yang drug pa rdo rje 'chang /
translated: Moreover, he is Vajradhara, the sixth.

original: me long lta bu la sogs pa ye shes lnga'i rang bzhin gzugs la sogs pa phung po lnga'i bdag nyid can kho na'o //
analyzed: me long lta bu la sogs pa ye shes lnga'i rang bzhin gzugs la sogs pa phung po lnga'i bdag nyid can kho na'o //

original: rdo rje sems dpa'i snyems byas na //
analyzed: rdo rje sems dpa'i snyems byas na //

original: rkang pa g-yas pa brkyang byas te //
analyzed: rkang pa g-yas pa brkyang byas te //

analyzed: zhes pa slob dpon ston pa gang gis rdo rje sems dpa'i snyems pa dpa' ba dang khengs pa byas pa de ni dkyil 'khor gyi slob dpon te /

analyzed: gsungs pa / phyag gnyis kye'i rdo rje sbyor bas kye'i rdo rje phyag gnyis pa'i sbyor ba las te /

analyzed: dkyil 'khor gyi skabs yin pa'i phyir dkyil 'khor nyid du 'jug par bya'o zhes shes par bya'o //

original: yang na / rdo rje ni mi phyed pa'o //
analyzed: yang na / rdo rje ni mi phyed pa'o //

original: sems dpa' ni srid pa gsum gcig pa nyid de /

original: rdo rje sems dpa'i sgras shes rab dang thabs dbyer med pa gnyis su med pa'i ye shes te ;
analyzed: rdo rje sems dpa'i sgras shes rab dang thabs dbyer med pa gnyis su med pa'i ye shes te ;

analyzed: h'i zhes pa rdo rje gsum dbyer med pa bdag med ma'i ye shes so //

original: h'i yig ni de nyid rdo rje 'chang dang bdag med ma'i rang bzhin gyi ye shes so //
analyzed: h'i yig ni de nyid rdo rje 'chang dang bdag med ma'i rang bzhin gyi ye shes so //
translated: The syllable hai is the intuition whose nature is Vajradhara and Nairatmya.

original: de nyid kyi phyir 'jigs byed de /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir 'jigs byed de /
translated: For that very reason, he is Bhairava,

original: bdag med ma ni rang bzhin med pa nyid kyis nyan thos la sogs pa thams cad 'jigs par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag med ma ni rang bzhin med pa nyid kyis nyan thos la sogs pa thams cad 'jigs par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because Nairatmya, by her very nature of non-substantiality, terrifies all the Sravakas, etc.

original: 'dis ni h'um h'um snyems par byed pa dang / zhes pa 'dis ye shes lnga dang sku gsum gyi bdag nyid can bdag med ma dang dbyer med pa'i rdo rje 'chang ngo //
analyzed: 'dis ni h'um h'um snyems par byed pa dang / zhes pa 'dis ye shes lnga dang sku gsum gyi bdag nyid can bdag med ma dang dbyer med pa'i rdo rje 'chang ngo //
translated: This means Vajradhara, who is indivisible from Nairatmya, the embodiment of the five intuitions and three bodies, by the words, ‚Äúhai hai, he is haughty.‚Äù

original: h'i h'i rnam pa 'jigs @183b byed de //
analyzed: h'i h'i rnam pa 'jigs @183b byed de //
translated: Hai hai is the form of Bhairava.

original: zhes pa 'dis kyang ye shes lnga dang sku gsum gyi bdag nyid can rdo rje 'chang dang dbyer med pa'i bdag med ma ste /
analyzed: zhes pa 'dis kyang ye shes lnga dang sku gsum gyi bdag nyid can rdo rje 'chang dang dbyer med pa'i bdag med ma ste /
translated: This also refers to NairƒÅtmya, who is inseparable from Vajradhara, whose nature is the five intuitions and the three spiritual bodies.

original: gnyis ka la yang gnyis ka dbyer med pa kho na'o //
analyzed: gnyis ka la yang gnyis ka dbyer med pa kho na'o //
translated: Both of them are inseparable.

original: phyi nas de nyid yang dag bshad //
analyzed: phyi nas de nyid yang dag bshad //
translated: Then, that reality is explained.

original: rnam dag ye shes rang bzhin can //
analyzed: rnam dag ye shes rang bzhin can //
translated: It has the nature of pure intuition.

original: phyi nas bar ma chad par de kho na bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: phyi nas bar ma chad par de kho na bshad par bya'o //
translated: Then, without interruption, that reality is to be explained.

original: khyad par ci zhe na /
analyzed: khyad par ci zhe na /
translated: What is its distinction?

original: rnam dag ste /
analyzed: rnam dag ste /
translated: It is pure.

original: rim pa gnyis rnam par dag par gyur pa de kho na'i rang bzhin can no //
analyzed: rim pa gnyis rnam par dag par gyur pa de kho na'i rang bzhin can no //
translated: It has the nature of that reality, which is the purity of the two stages.

original: de nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir /
translated: Therefore,

original: 'khor ba rnam par byang ba dag / khyad par cung zad kyang yod min //
analyzed: 'khor ba rnam par byang ba dag / khyad par cung zad kyang yod min //
translated: samsara and nirvana are not the slightest bit different,üîΩnot even the tiniest particle.

original: gnyis ka rnam par dag pa'i phyir 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa ni khyad par cung zad kyang cha phra mo tsam yang yod pa ma yin pa kho na'o //
analyzed: gnyis ka rnam par dag pa'i phyir 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa ni khyad par cung zad kyang cha phra mo tsam yang yod pa ma yin pa kho na'o //
translated: Because both are pure, samsara and nirvana are not the slightest bit different, not even the tiniest particle.

original: yang na / phyi nas zhes pa de ma thag par ma chad pa kho na ste /
analyzed: yang na / phyi nas zhes pa de ma thag par ma chad pa kho na ste /
translated: Or else, then means immediately, without interruption.

original: de nyid ces pa yang dag pa'i ye shes so //
analyzed: de nyid ces pa yang dag pa'i ye shes so //
translated: Thatness is the authentic pristine consciousness.

original: khyad par ci zhe na /
analyzed: khyad par ci zhe na /
translated: What is the difference?

original: yang dag bar bshad pa gang zhig mngon par brjod pa de ni yang dag par bshad pa'o //
analyzed: yang dag bar bshad pa gang zhig mngon par brjod pa de ni yang dag par bshad pa'o //
translated: The explanation that is authentic is the expression of that.

original: shin tu rnam dag ces pa kun rdzob dang don dam pa dbyer med pa phul du byung bas yang dag pa dri ma dang bral ba ste /
analyzed: shin tu rnam dag ces pa kun rdzob dang don dam pa dbyer med pa phul du byung bas yang dag pa dri ma dang bral ba ste /
translated: Very pure is the authentic, stainless, supreme, indivisible relative and ultimate.

original: ye shes rang bzhin can rtog pa gcig pu'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: ye shes rang bzhin can rtog pa gcig pu'i rang bzhin no //
translated: It is the nature of pristine consciousness, the nature of the sole realization.

original: de nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir /
translated: For that reason:üîΩSamsara and nirvana

original: 'khor ba rnam par byang ba dag / khyad par cung zad kyang yod min //
analyzed: 'khor ba rnam par byang ba dag / khyad par cung zad kyang yod min //
translated: do not have the slightest difference.

original: zhes pa don gsal ba kho na'o //
analyzed: zhes pa don gsal ba kho na'o //
translated: This is the meaning of the clear words.

original: 'di ltar ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: 'di ltar ji ltar zhe na /
translated: If it is asked how is that so,üîΩit is said:

original: gsungs pa / mchog dgar bsgom bya med cing sgom pa po yang med //
analyzed: gsungs pa / mchog dgar bsgom bya med cing sgom pa po yang med //
translated: There is no meditation in supreme bliss, nor is there a meditator.

original: lus kyang med de gzung ba med cing 'dzin pa med /üîΩsha dang khrag med bshad pa dang ni gci ba med //
analyzed: lus kyang med de gzung ba med cing 'dzin pa med / sha dang khrag med bshad pa dang ni gci ba med //
translated: There is no body, no object to grasp, and no grasper.üîΩThere is no flesh and blood, no feces and urine,

original: skyug khro med cing rmongs med gtsang sbra dag byed med //
analyzed: skyug khro med cing rmongs med gtsang sbra dag byed med //
translated: no vomit and bile, no ignorance, and no purification.

original: chags med sdang med gti mug med cing phrag dog med //
analyzed: chags med sdang med gti mug med cing phrag dog med //
translated: Without attachment, without aversion, without delusion, without envy,

original: ser sna med cing nga rgyal yang med mthong bya med ;
analyzed: ser sna med cing nga rgyal yang med mthong bya med ;
translated: without avarice, without pride, without something to be seen,

original: /'byung dang 'byung ba po med bshes dang dgra med de //
analyzed: /'byung dang 'byung ba po med bshes dang dgra med de //
translated: without elements and without an experiencer of elements, without friends and without enemies,

original: rlabs dang bral ba'i lhan cig skyes pa sna tshogs brjod //
analyzed: rlabs dang bral ba'i lhan cig skyes pa sna tshogs brjod //
translated: the innate is said to be various, free from waves.

original: mchog dgar zhes pa mchog ni rdo rje 'chang ngo //
analyzed: mchog dgar zhes pa mchog ni rdo rje 'chang ngo //
translated: Supreme joy is supreme, that is, Vajradhara,

original: dga' ba ni bdag med ma'o //
analyzed: dga' ba ni bdag med ma'o //
translated: and joy is NairƒÅtmya.

original: mchog dang dga' ba yang mchog dga' ste /
analyzed: mchog dang dga' ba yang mchog dga' ste /
translated: Supreme and joy are supreme joy,

original: rdo rje 'chang dang dbyer med pa'i bdag med ma'i ye shes so //
analyzed: rdo rje 'chang dang dbyer med pa'i bdag med ma'i ye shes so //
translated: the pristine awareness of NairƒÅtmya, who is inseparable from Vajradhara.

original: de la de'i tshe ci zhe na /
analyzed: de la de'i tshe ci zhe na /
translated: What is it at that time?

original: bsgom bya med bsgom par bya ba med ba ste /
analyzed: bsgom bya med bsgom par bya ba med ba ste /
translated: There is nothing to meditate on, nothing to meditate with,

original: lhag par bsgrub bar bya ba med pa'o //
analyzed: lhag par bsgrub bar bya ba med pa'o //
translated: nothing to be accomplished.

original: gang gi phyir sgom pa po med /
analyzed: gang gi phyir sgom pa po med /
translated: Because there is no meditator,

original: lhag par sgrub pa po'ang med do //
analyzed: lhag par sgrub pa po'ang med do //
translated: and also no one to accomplish anything.

original: ji ltar zhe na /üîΩlus kyang med de gang gi phyir lus med pa ni snang ba'i mtshan nyid kyi lus rang bzhin @184a * //
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na / lus kyang med de gang gi phyir lus med pa ni snang ba'i mtshan nyid kyi lus rang bzhin @184a * //
translated: How is that?

original: med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: There is no body, because the body, which has the characteristic of appearance, is essenceless.

original: gzung ba med pa ni lus bkag pa nyid kyi phyir gzung ba 'dzin pa'i mtshan nyid med do //
analyzed: gzung ba med pa ni lus bkag pa nyid kyi phyir gzung ba 'dzin pa'i mtshan nyid med do //
translated: Since the body is negated, there is no characteristic of the apprehender of the apprehended.

original: de med pa'i phyir 'dzin pa yang med do //
analyzed: de med pa'i phyir 'dzin pa yang med do //
translated: Since that does not exist, there is no apprehender.

original: de nyid kyi phyir lus bkag pa nyid las /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir lus bkag pa nyid las /
translated: For that very reason,

original: sha dang khrag med bshad ba dang ni gci ba med /
analyzed: sha dang khrag med bshad ba dang ni gci ba med /
translated: there is no flesh and blood, no feces and urine,üîΩsince the body is negated.

original: 'dis de bzhin gshegs pa bzhi yang 'od dpag med kho na'i nang du gtogs so zhes rab tu bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis de bzhin gshegs pa bzhi yang 'od dpag med kho na'i nang du gtogs so zhes rab tu bstan to //
translated: This also teaches that the four thus-gone ones are included within AmitƒÅbha alone.

original: mchog dgar zhes pa'i gsung las dga' ba yang 'od dpag med dang dbyer med pa kho na'o //
analyzed: mchog dgar zhes pa'i gsung las dga' ba yang 'od dpag med dang dbyer med pa kho na'o //
translated: The statement ‚Äúsupreme joy‚Äù is the joy inseparable from AmitƒÅbha.

original: skyug bro med de de nyid kyi phyir smad pa med pa ste /
analyzed: skyug bro med de de nyid kyi phyir smad pa med pa ste /
translated: Since that is so, there is no disgust, and therefore there is no contempt.

original: de ltar yang bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa /üîΩrtag tu smad pa'i blo gros ni //
analyzed: de ltar yang bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa / rtag tu smad pa'i blo gros ni //
translated: The BhagavƒÅn also said:üîΩThe mind of contempt

original: 'dir ni bdag la skrag pa skye //
analyzed: 'dir ni bdag la skrag pa skye //
translated: is always fearful for me here.

original: zhes pa'o // de nyid kyi phyir rmongs pa med //
analyzed: zhes pa'o // de nyid kyi phyir rmongs pa med //
translated: For that very reason, there is no delusion.

original: rmongs pa ma rig pa 'khrul pa med do //
analyzed: rmongs pa ma rig pa 'khrul pa med do //
translated: There is no delusion, ignorance, or confusion.

original: de nyid kyi phyir gtsang sbra dang byed med //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir gtsang sbra dang byed med //
translated: For that very reason, there is no purity or ritual purity.

original: gtsang sbra ni shin tu rnam par dag pa'o //
analyzed: gtsang sbra ni shin tu rnam par dag pa'o //
translated: Purity is very pure.

original: dag byed ni me lta bur mi shes pa ma lus bsreg par byed pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dag byed ni me lta bur mi shes pa ma lus bsreg par byed pa'i phyir /
translated: The purifier is like fire, because it burns all ignorance without remainder.

original: chags med 'od chags 'od dpag tu med pa gsung rdo rje'o //
analyzed: chags med 'od chags 'od dpag tu med pa gsung rdo rje'o //
translated: The one without attachment is the light of AmitƒÅbha, the vajra of speech.

original: sdang med zhe sdang mi bskyod pa thugs rdo rje'o //
analyzed: sdang med zhe sdang mi bskyod pa thugs rdo rje'o //
translated: The one without hatred is the hatred of Ak·π£obhya, the vajra of mind.

original: gti mug med gti mug rnam par snang mdzad du sku rdo rje ste /
analyzed: gti mug med gti mug rnam par snang mdzad du sku rdo rje ste /
translated: The one without delusion is the delusion of Vairocana, the vajra of body.

original: de yang med do //
analyzed: de yang med do //
translated: And that also does not exist.

original: phrag dog med phrag dog don yod grub pa /
analyzed: phrag dog med phrag dog don yod grub pa /
translated: The one without envy is the envy of Amoghasiddhi,

original: shes rab dang thabs dbyer med pas rnam par snang mdzad la rab tu zhugs pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: shes rab dang thabs dbyer med pas rnam par snang mdzad la rab tu zhugs pa'i phyir te /
translated: because wisdom and method are inseparable, and he is fully engaged in Vairocana.

original: de yang med do //
analyzed: de yang med do //
translated: And that also does not exist.üîΩThe one without avarice is the Ratnasa·πÉbhava of AmitƒÅbha,

original: ser sna med de bzhin du rin chen dbang po 'od dpag med la rab tu zhugs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ser sna med de bzhin du rin chen dbang po 'od dpag med la rab tu zhugs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because he is fully engaged in AmitƒÅbha.

original: nga rgyal med rdo rje sems dpa' yang med de /
analyzed: nga rgyal med rdo rje sems dpa' yang med de /
translated: The one without pride is the Vajrasattva that does not exist,

original: de bzhin du mi bskyod pa la dbyer med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du mi bskyod pa la dbyer med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because he is fully engaged in Ak·π£obhya, without differentiation.

original: 'dis ni shes rab dang thabs dbyer med pa rdo rje gsum gyi ngo bo nyid kyis sku gsum dang ye shes lnga'i bdag nyid kyi phyir rdo rje 'chang gi mthong bya med de thams cad snang ba med par rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dis ni shes rab dang thabs dbyer med pa rdo rje gsum gyi ngo bo nyid kyis sku gsum dang ye shes lnga'i bdag nyid kyi phyir rdo rje 'chang gi mthong bya med de thams cad snang ba med par rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This means that there is no object of seeing of Vajradhara because of the nature of the three vajras, which are the inseparability of wisdom and means, and because of the nature of the three bodies and the five pristine wisdoms, because of the realization that everything is without appearance.

original: 'byung ba med ces pa skye ba'i bya ba bkag pa'o //üîΩ'byung ba po yang med de /
analyzed: 'byung ba med ces pa skye ba'i bya ba bkag pa'o // 'byung ba po yang med de /
translated: ‚Äú Non-arising‚Äù is the negation of the action of arising.üîΩ‚Äú There is no arising‚Äù is the negation of the agent of arising.

original: skye ba 'gyur ba ni 'byung ba po'o //
analyzed: skye ba 'gyur ba ni 'byung ba po'o //
translated: The arising of arising is the agent of arising.

original: de yang med de /
analyzed: de yang med de /
translated: That also does not exist.

original: chos thams cad gdod ma nas ma skyes pa'i phyir /
analyzed: chos thams cad gdod ma nas ma skyes pa'i phyir /
translated: Because all phenomena are primordially non-arisen,

original: skye ba dang skye ba po gnyis ka yang bkag pa'o //
analyzed: skye ba dang skye ba po gnyis ka yang bkag pa'o //
translated: both arising and the agent of arising are negated.

original: yang na / 'byung dang 'byung ba po med 'byung ba yul dang dbang po dang / 'byung ba bo sems so //
analyzed: yang na / 'byung dang 'byung ba po med 'byung ba yul dang dbang po dang / 'byung ba bo sems so //
translated: Alternatively, ‚Äúnon-arising and agent of arising‚Äù are the object and sense faculty of arising, and the mind is the agent of arising.

original: de gsum ka yang med de rdo rje gsum dbyer med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de gsum ka yang med de rdo rje gsum dbyer med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Those three do not exist because the three vajras are inseparable.

original: de nyid kyi phyir bshes dang dgra med //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir bshes dang dgra med //
translated: For that very reason, there is no friend or foe.

original: bshes zhes pa sems te de med do //
analyzed: bshes zhes pa sems te de med do //
translated: ‚Äú Friend‚Äù is the mind, and that does not exist.

original: dgra zhes pa dgra lta bu ste /
analyzed: dgra zhes pa dgra lta bu ste /
translated: ‚Äú Foe‚Äù is like an enemy.

original: gang zhig yul dang dbang po de rnams yin la de yang med de /
analyzed: gang zhig yul dang dbang po de rnams yin la de yang med de /
translated: Those are the objects and faculties, and they do not exist.

original: rdo @184b rje gsum dbyer med pa nyid kyi phyir ro /
analyzed: rdo @184b rje gsum dbyer med pa nyid kyi phyir ro /
translated: Because the three vajras are inseparable.

original: yang na gang bshes ni dga' ba'o //
analyzed: yang na gang bshes ni dga' ba'o //
translated: Or, the one who is friendly is the one who is pleased.

original: dgra ni mi dga' ba'o //
analyzed: dgra ni mi dga' ba'o //
translated: The enemy is the one who is displeased.

original: gnyis ka yang med de mdzes pa dang mi mdzes pa med ces pa'i don to //
analyzed: gnyis ka yang med de mdzes pa dang mi mdzes pa med ces pa'i don to //
translated: Both do not exist, meaning there is no beauty and no ugliness.

original: gang zhig gsungs pa /
analyzed: gang zhig gsungs pa /
translated: What was said?

original: ji ltar chu ni chu la rab zhugs pa //
analyzed: ji ltar chu ni chu la rab zhugs pa //
translated: Just as water is completely absorbed into water,

original: de bzhin du ni ro mnyam par gyur pa ste //
analyzed: de bzhin du ni ro mnyam par gyur pa ste //
translated: in the same way, they become of equal taste.

original: skyon dang yon tan sems kyi rnam pas skye //
analyzed: skyon dang yon tan sems kyi rnam pas skye //
translated: Faults and good qualities arise from the mind‚Äôs aspect.

original: mi mthun phyogs ni gang yang yod ma yin /
analyzed: mi mthun phyogs ni gang yang yod ma yin /
translated: There is no discordant side at all.

original: zhes so // 'di dag thams cad ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: zhes so // 'di dag thams cad ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How is all this?

original: gsungs pa / rlabs dang bral ba'i lhan cig skyes pa sna tshogs brjod //
analyzed: gsungs pa / rlabs dang bral ba'i lhan cig skyes pa sna tshogs brjod //
translated: It is said: The connate is free from waves, and is various.

original: gang gi phyir rlabs dang 'dra ba ni rlabs te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir rlabs dang 'dra ba ni rlabs te /
translated: Because it is like waves, it is a wave.

original: rnam par rtog pa rnams so //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa rnams so //
translated: It is the conceptual thoughts.

original: lhan cig skyes par brjod pa lhan cig skyes pa'i ming can gang la de rnams dang bral ba ni rlabs dang bral ba'i lhan cig skyes par brjod de /
analyzed: lhan cig skyes par brjod pa lhan cig skyes pa'i ming can gang la de rnams dang bral ba ni rlabs dang bral ba'i lhan cig skyes par brjod de /
translated: That which is free from those is called the ‚Äúinnate free from waves.‚Äù

original: lhan cig skyes pa de ni kun du rtog pa thams cad las 'das pa'o //
analyzed: lhan cig skyes pa de ni kun du rtog pa thams cad las 'das pa'o //
translated: That innate nature is beyond all conceptual thought.

original: de nyid kyi phyir sna tshogs te /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir sna tshogs te /
translated: Therefore, it is ‚Äúdiverse,‚Äù

original: gzugs sna tshogs pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs sna tshogs pa'o //
translated: meaning that it is of various forms.

original: thams cad de'i bdag nyid kyis de'i nang du gtogs par gyur pa'i phyir zhes dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: thams cad de'i bdag nyid kyis de'i nang du gtogs par gyur pa'i phyir zhes dgongs pa'o //
translated: It is ‚Äúall,‚Äù because everything is included within it.

original: rdo rje snying pos 'di skad gsol //
analyzed: rdo rje snying pos 'di skad gsol //
translated: Vajragarbha asked:

original: gzod nas rang bzhin med pa yis //
analyzed: gzod nas rang bzhin med pa yis //
translated: ‚ÄúSince it is primordially without inherent nature,

original: lus kyi rang bzhin dag pa ni //
analyzed: lus kyi rang bzhin dag pa ni //
translated: the nature of the body is pure.

original: ci slad 'byung ba'i bdag nyid lags //
analyzed: ci slad 'byung ba'i bdag nyid lags //
translated: Why is it the nature of the elements?‚Äù

original: rdo rje snying po zhes ba kye'i rdo rjer brjod de //
analyzed: rdo rje snying po zhes ba kye'i rdo rjer brjod de //
translated: Vajragarbha is called ‚ÄúVajra of the Essence‚Äù

original: mi phyed pa'i sku'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi phyed pa'i sku'i phyir ro //
translated: because his body is indivisible.

original: gsol ba zhes pa rdo rje 'chang la zhus pa ste /
analyzed: gsol ba zhes pa rdo rje 'chang la zhus pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúAsked‚Äù means that he asked Vajradhara.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How?

original: rgyu gang gi phyir mchog dga' la bsgom bya dang sgom pa po la sogs pa rnams bkag pa de'i phyir /
analyzed: rgyu gang gi phyir mchog dga' la bsgom bya dang sgom pa po la sogs pa rnams bkag pa de'i phyir /
translated: The reason is that the object of meditation, the meditator, and so forth are prohibited in the supreme joy.

original: the tshom skyes pa na zhus pa gal te lus ni lhan cig skyes pa'i sku ste /
analyzed: the tshom skyes pa na zhus pa gal te lus ni lhan cig skyes pa'i sku ste /
translated: When doubt arises, it is asked: If the body is the innate body,

original: rang bzhin ni yang dag pa ji lta ba'i rang bzhin gyis dag pa nyug ma yongs su dag pa'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin ni yang dag pa ji lta ba'i rang bzhin gyis dag pa nyug ma yongs su dag pa'o //
translated: and the nature is completely pure, pure by the nature of the way things really are,

original: de nyid kyi phyir gzod ma thog ma nyid nas rang bzhin med pa yin na /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir gzod ma thog ma nyid nas rang bzhin med pa yin na /
translated: then for that very reason, if it is beginningless and essenceless,

original: ci slad 'byung ba'i bdag nyid lags //
analyzed: ci slad 'byung ba'i bdag nyid lags //
translated: why is it of the nature of the elements?

original: ji ltar yang dag pa ma yin pa 'byung ba chen po lnga'i rang bzhin ni lags zhes pa'o //
analyzed: ji ltar yang dag pa ma yin pa 'byung ba chen po lnga'i rang bzhin ni lags zhes pa'o //
translated: How is it the nature of the five great elements that are not real?

original: de la bcom ldan 'das rdo rje can //
analyzed: de la bcom ldan 'das rdo rje can //
translated: To that, the Blessed One, the Vajra Holder,

original: mkha' 'gro bde ba sbyin pas gsungs //
analyzed: mkha' 'gro bde ba sbyin pas gsungs //
translated: said, the dakini who bestows bliss:üîΩThe supreme nature free from waves

original: rlabs dang bral ba'i rang bzhin mchog / thams cad lus la rnam par gnas //
analyzed: rlabs dang bral ba'i rang bzhin mchog / thams cad lus la rnam par gnas //
translated: abides in all bodies.

original: de la zhes pa rdo rje snying po'i rnam par rtog pa de la bcom ldan 'das rdo rje can rdo rje 'chang gis gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: de la zhes pa rdo rje snying po'i rnam par rtog pa de la bcom ldan 'das rdo rje can rdo rje 'chang gis gsungs pa'o //
translated: In that, in the concept of the vajra essence, the Blessed One, the Vajra Holder, Vajradhara, spoke.

original: khyad par ci zhe na /
analyzed: khyad par ci zhe na /
translated: What is the distinction?

original: mkha' 'gro ma bdag med ma la sogs pa rnams la bde ba ye shes ster ba'i phyir bde ba sbyin pa'o //
analyzed: mkha' 'gro ma bdag med ma la sogs pa rnams la bde ba ye shes ster ba'i phyir bde ba sbyin pa'o //
translated: It is the giver of bliss because it bestows the bliss of intuition upon the dakinis, Nairatmya, etc.

original: rlabs dang bral ba'i rang bzhin bdag @185a * //
analyzed: rlabs dang bral ba'i rang bzhin bdag @185a * //
translated: The nature of the self free from waves,

original: ces pa gang gi bdag nyid rnam par rtog pa med pa'i rang bzhin gyi skur gyur pa de ni rlabs dang bral ba'i rang bzhin bdag go //
analyzed: ces pa gang gi bdag nyid rnam par rtog pa med pa'i rang bzhin gyi skur gyur pa de ni rlabs dang bral ba'i rang bzhin bdag go //
translated: the nature of the self free from waves is the body that has become the nature of the absence of concepts.

original: de nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir /
translated: For that very reason,

original: thams cad lus la rnam par gnas //
analyzed: thams cad lus la rnam par gnas //
translated: it abides in all bodies.

original: brtan pa dang g-yo pa la sogs pa dngos po mtha' dag la rnam par gnas te /
analyzed: brtan pa dang g-yo pa la sogs pa dngos po mtha' dag la rnam par gnas te /
translated: It abides in all things, such as the animate and inanimate,

original: khyad par 'phags pa'i tshul khrims aa bdag med ma dang / ba rdo rje 'chang kho na'o //
analyzed: khyad par 'phags pa'i tshul khrims aa bdag med ma dang / ba rdo rje 'chang kho na'o //
translated: and the self is only Vajradhara, the superior morality.

original: rim pa 'dis gnas pa ni g-yo ba med pa'o //
analyzed: rim pa 'dis gnas pa ni g-yo ba med pa'o //
translated: Abiding in this way is unwavering.

original: ci zhe na gsungs pa /
analyzed: ci zhe na gsungs pa /
translated: What is that? It is said:üîΩThe nature of the self free from waves, abiding in all bodies, is the supreme morality.

original: 'byung ba'i bdag nyid can kho na lus yin no zhes pa'o //
analyzed: 'byung ba'i bdag nyid can kho na lus yin no zhes pa'o //
translated: The body is of the nature of the elements alone.

original: de'i phyir gsungs pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir gsungs pa /
translated: Therefore it is said:

original: bo la kakko la sbyor bas /
analyzed: bo la kakko la sbyor bas /
translated: By the union of the vajra and lotus,

original: sa ni de la skye bar 'gyur /
analyzed: sa ni de la skye bar 'gyur /
translated: the earth is born there.

original: de la zhes pa lhan cig skyes pa la sa'i khams skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la zhes pa lhan cig skyes pa la sa'i khams skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: There, in the innate, the earth element is born.

original: bo la rdo rje'o //
analyzed: bo la rdo rje'o //
translated: The vajra is the male organ.

original: kakko la padma ste /
analyzed: kakko la padma ste /
translated: The lotus is the female organ.

original: rdo rje dang padma mnyam par sbyor bas zhes dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: rdo rje dang padma mnyam par sbyor bas zhes dgongs pa'o //
translated: The meaning is that by the union of the vajra and lotus,üîΩthe earth element is born there, in the innate.üîΩAgain,

original: slar yang / dang por reg par 'dod pa ste /
analyzed: slar yang / dang por reg par 'dod pa ste /
translated: first there is the desire to touch.

original: zhes pa'i gsung las reg pas sra ba'i chos can te /
analyzed: zhes pa'i gsung las reg pas sra ba'i chos can te /
translated: From the statement, by touch, the earth element is born,

original: sa dang sra ba'i rang bzhin rtogs pa las sa'i khams so //
analyzed: sa dang sra ba'i rang bzhin rtogs pa las sa'i khams so //
translated: from the realization of the earth and its nature of solidity.

original: de la lhan cig skyes pa dga' ba'i rang bzhin gyis skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la lhan cig skyes pa dga' ba'i rang bzhin gyis skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: There, the earth element is born in the form of the innate bliss.

original: byang sems zhu ba'i rnam pa las /
analyzed: byang sems zhu ba'i rnam pa las /
translated: From the melting of the bodhicitta,

original: chu yi khams kyang yang dag 'byung //
analyzed: chu yi khams kyang yang dag 'byung //
translated: the water element also arises.

original: lhan cig skyes pa de la byang chub kyi sems skye bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: lhan cig skyes pa de la byang chub kyi sems skye bar 'gyur te /
translated: There, in the innate, the bodhicitta is born.

original: khu ba 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: khu ba 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The semen is born.

original: de yang zhu ba'i rang bzhin gyi phyir chu'i khams 'byung zhing skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de yang zhu ba'i rang bzhin gyi phyir chu'i khams 'byung zhing skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Moreover, since it is the nature of supplication, the water element arises and comes into being.

original: bskyod pa las ni me skye 'gyur //
analyzed: bskyod pa las ni me skye 'gyur //
translated: From the shaking, fire is born.

original: rdo rje dang padma bskyod pas me'i khams skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rdo rje dang padma bskyod pas me'i khams skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: From the shaking of the vajra and lotus, the fire element is born.

original: 'gro ba rlung du rab tu grags //
analyzed: 'gro ba rlung du rab tu grags //
translated: Going is well known as wind.

original: g-yo ba'i rang bzhin nyid las rlung gi khams su brjod de //üîΩbde bar gyur pa nam mkha'i khams //
analyzed: g-yo ba'i rang bzhin nyid las rlung gi khams su brjod de // bde bar gyur pa nam mkha'i khams //
translated: From the nature of movement, it is called the wind element.üîΩThe state of bliss is the space element.

original: bde bar gyur pa'i ngo bo nyid las nam mkha'i khams so //
analyzed: bde bar gyur pa'i ngo bo nyid las nam mkha'i khams so //
translated: From the nature of the state of bliss, there is the space element.

original: 'di ni lnga po rnams kyis zhes pa sa la sogs pa 'byung ba chen po lnga po rnams kyis yongs su bskor zhing thams cad du khyab pa de ni lhan cig skyes pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni lnga po rnams kyis zhes pa sa la sogs pa 'byung ba chen po lnga po rnams kyis yongs su bskor zhing thams cad du khyab pa de ni lhan cig skyes pa'o //
translated: This is the connate state, which is completely pervaded by the five, the five great elements, earth, and so on.

original: 'dis ni bskyed pa'i mtshan nyid kyi phyir lus lhan cig skyes pa'i ye shes byung ba chen po'i bdag nyid can no //
analyzed: 'dis ni bskyed pa'i mtshan nyid kyi phyir lus lhan cig skyes pa'i ye shes byung ba chen po'i bdag nyid can no //
translated: Since this is the characteristic of generation, the connate gnosis of the body is the nature of the great elements.

original: de'i phyir mar la mar bzhag pa lta bur 'dod chags dang bral ba rnam par 'dres par gyur ba bdag med ma dang byang chub sems shes rab dang thabs dbyer med pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir mar la mar bzhag pa lta bur 'dod chags dang bral ba rnam par 'dres par gyur ba bdag med ma dang byang chub sems shes rab dang thabs dbyer med pa /
translated: Therefore, like placing butter in butter, one should meditate on the inseparability of the wisdom and the bodhicitta of NairƒÅtmya.üîΩ

original: bden pa gnyis kyi bdag nyid can ye shes lnga dang sku gsum gyi rang bzhin rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa'i rgyur gyur pa ste /
analyzed: bden pa gnyis kyi bdag nyid can ye shes lnga dang sku gsum gyi rang bzhin rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa'i rgyur gyur pa ste /
translated: Therefore, like placing butter in butter, one should meditate on the indivisible wisdom and means, i.e., the emptiness and appearance of the two truths, which is the cause for the manifest, complete enlightenment of the omniscience of the nature of the five wisdoms and three bodies.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis rdo rje snying po'i the tshom bsal ba'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis rdo rje snying po'i the tshom bsal ba'o //
translated: This is the removal of the doubts of Vajragarbha by the BhagavƒÅn.

original: yang na / @185b mchog dga' rdo rje snying po bdag med ma'i ye shes bsgom par bya ba dang sgom pa la sogs pa rnams mi dmigs pa'i phyir zhes pa'i rgyu las /
analyzed: yang na / @185b mchog dga' rdo rje snying po bdag med ma'i ye shes bsgom par bya ba dang sgom pa la sogs pa rnams mi dmigs pa'i phyir zhes pa'i rgyu las /
translated: Or, the supreme joy, Vajragarbha, meditates on the wisdom of NairƒÅtmya, and so on, because of the non-apprehension of meditation and so forth.

original: kye'i rdo rje brjod pa bdag med ma dang dbyer med pa rdo rje 'chang ste /
analyzed: kye'i rdo rje brjod pa bdag med ma dang dbyer med pa rdo rje 'chang ste /
translated: The expression ‚ÄúVajra Bearer‚Äù is Vajradhara, inseparable from NairƒÅtmya.

original: kam ye shes so //
analyzed: kam ye shes so //
translated: ‚Äú Ka‚Äù is wisdom.üîΩ‚Äú

original: gsol pa yang dag pa'i bdag nyid yang dag pa'i de kho na phyin ci ma log pa ste /
analyzed: gsol pa yang dag pa'i bdag nyid yang dag pa'i de kho na phyin ci ma log pa ste /
translated: The purification is the correct nature, the unmistaken reality.

original: gang gi bdag nyid dang rang bzhin de ni yang dag pa'i bdag nyid can gyi ye shes so //
analyzed: gang gi bdag nyid dang rang bzhin de ni yang dag pa'i bdag nyid can gyi ye shes so //
translated: The nature and essence of that is the wisdom that has the correct nature.

original: ci'i slad du rang bzhin dang rang gi ngo bo yang dag pa ji lta ba'i lus dag pa ste /
analyzed: ci'i slad du rang bzhin dang rang gi ngo bo yang dag pa ji lta ba'i lus dag pa ste /
translated: Why is it the pure body of the nature and the essence just as it is?

original: lus zhes pa sku gsum yin zhing ma ning du bstan pa'o //
analyzed: lus zhes pa sku gsum yin zhing ma ning du bstan pa'o //
translated: The body is the three bodies, and it is taught to be neuter.

original: gang gi phyir gzod ma dang po nyid nas rang bzhin med pa ste /
analyzed: gang gi phyir gzod ma dang po nyid nas rang bzhin med pa ste /
translated: Because it is beginningless, it is natureless.

original: aa bdag med ma dang / sva rdo rje 'chang ste gnyis ka'i dngos po ni gnyis ka'i bdag nyid can no //
analyzed: aa bdag med ma dang / sva rdo rje 'chang ste gnyis ka'i dngos po ni gnyis ka'i bdag nyid can no //
translated: The two are A, which is NairƒÅtmya, and sva, which is Vajradhara, and the entity of both is the nature of both.

original: de ltar gyur pa'i kam ye shes bde pa ste /
analyzed: de ltar gyur pa'i kam ye shes bde pa ste /
translated: The ka is the wisdom bliss.

original: de la zhes pa de ltar rnam par gnas pa na bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: de la zhes pa de ltar rnam par gnas pa na bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: With regard to that, when it is thusly situated, the BhagavƒÅn said, Oh!

original: aa yig dang ha yig gi rang bzhin dbang phyug la sogs pa'i yon tan ma lus pa dang ldan pa rdo rje can gyi ye shes kyi sku'o //
analyzed: aa yig dang ha yig gi rang bzhin dbang phyug la sogs pa'i yon tan ma lus pa dang ldan pa rdo rje can gyi ye shes kyi sku'o //
translated: The nature of the letters A and HA, endowed with all the qualities of Mahesvara and so forth, is the wisdom body of the Vajra Holder.

original: de nyid kyi phyir mkha' 'gro ma bdag med ma la sogs pa rnams kyi bde ba ye shes ster ba'i phyir sbyin ba'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir mkha' 'gro ma bdag med ma la sogs pa rnams kyi bde ba ye shes ster ba'i phyir sbyin ba'o //
translated: For that very reason, it is generosity, because it bestows the bliss of wisdom to the dakinis, Nairatmya, and so forth.

original: de nyid kyi phyir de rnams kyi yang ye shes ni de'i rang bzhin nyi dkyil de'i nang du thim pa'o zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir de rnams kyi yang ye shes ni de'i rang bzhin nyi dkyil de'i nang du thim pa'o zhes pa'i don to //
translated: For that very reason, their wisdom is the nature of that, the mandala of the sun, dissolved into it.

original: de nyid kyi phyin rlabs dang bral ba'i rang bzhin bdag rtog pa dang rnam par rtog pa thams cad spang ba'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyin rlabs dang bral ba'i rang bzhin bdag rtog pa dang rnam par rtog pa thams cad spang ba'o //
translated: For that very reason, it is the nature free from waves, abandoning all thoughts and concepts of self.

original: thams cad lus la brtan pa dang g-yo ba la sogs pa'i lus la rnam par gnas pa khyab pa nyid kyis g-yo ba med pa'o //
analyzed: thams cad lus la brtan pa dang g-yo ba la sogs pa'i lus la rnam par gnas pa khyab pa nyid kyis g-yo ba med pa'o //
translated: It is immovable, because it pervades all bodies, animate and inanimate.

original: de ltar gyur pa'i rdo rje 'chang de nyid las skye bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ltar gyur pa'i rdo rje 'chang de nyid las skye bar 'gyur te /
translated: Vajradhara, who is such, arises from that.

original: de nyid bdag med ma'i rang bzhin yang dag par thob pa'o ;
analyzed: de nyid bdag med ma'i rang bzhin yang dag par thob pa'o ;
translated: He is the attainment of the nature of Nairatmya.

original: / ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: / ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How is that?üîΩFrom the union of the vajra and lotus, both are inseparable.

original: rdo rje dang padma mnyam par sbyor ba las gnyis ka dbyer med pas zhes pa'i don te /
analyzed: rdo rje dang padma mnyam par sbyor ba las gnyis ka dbyer med pas zhes pa'i don te /
translated: This is the meaning.

original: 'dis bskyed pa'i rim pa gsungs so //
analyzed: 'dis bskyed pa'i rim pa gsungs so //
translated: This teaches the creation stage.

original: de nyid byang chub kyi sems stong pa nyid dang snying rje dbyer med pa ste /
analyzed: de nyid byang chub kyi sems stong pa nyid dang snying rje dbyer med pa ste /
translated: That itself is the bodhicitta, the inseparability of emptiness and compassion.

original: byang chub kyi sems kyi rang bzhin zhu ba'i rang bzhin las zhu ba'i rnam pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems kyi rang bzhin zhu ba'i rang bzhin las zhu ba'i rnam pa'o //
translated: From the melting of the nature of bodhicitta, the form of melting arises.

original: rdo rje 'chang gang gi /üîΩchu yi khams ni yang dag 'byung //
analyzed: rdo rje 'chang gang gi / chu yi khams ni yang dag 'byung //
translated: From the vajra holder,üîΩthe water element arises.

original: zhes yang dag par 'byung ba ni 'byung ba ste /
analyzed: zhes yang dag par 'byung ba ni 'byung ba ste /
translated: The arising is the arising of the water element.

original: shin tu rnam par dag pa chos kyi dbyings kyi rang bzhin rdzogs pa'i rim par gsungs so //
analyzed: shin tu rnam par dag pa chos kyi dbyings kyi rang bzhin rdzogs pa'i rim par gsungs so //
translated: This teaches the perfection stage, the nature of the utterly pure dharmadhatu.

original: bskyod pa las ni me skye 'gyur //üîΩzhes pa shes rab dang thabs dag las rtag tu me gnyis ka'i rang bzhin med pa @186a * //
analyzed: bskyod pa las ni me skye 'gyur // zhes pa shes rab dang thabs dag las rtag tu me gnyis ka'i rang bzhin med pa @186a * //
translated: From the shaking, fire arises.

original: nyid skye zhing rdzogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nyid skye zhing rdzogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: From wisdom and method, the fire of the nature of both always arises and is perfected.

original: de las kyang 'gro ba ste /
analyzed: de las kyang 'gro ba ste /
translated: From that, the world arises.

original: rtog pa rlung ye shas su rab tu grags te /
analyzed: rtog pa rlung ye shas su rab tu grags te /
translated: The wind of conceptual thought is well known as pristine consciousness.

original: phul du byung bas mngon par gsal ba'o //
analyzed: phul du byung bas mngon par gsal ba'o //
translated: It is clearly manifest by being the best.

original: bde bar gyur ba zhes pa bde ba ni ye shes so //
analyzed: bde bar gyur ba zhes pa bde ba ni ye shes so //
translated: The state of bliss is bliss, which is pristine consciousness.

original: de'i dngos po ni bde bar gyur pa ste /
analyzed: de'i dngos po ni bde bar gyur pa ste /
translated: Its entity is the state of bliss.

original: nam mkha'i khams 'od gsal ba chos kyi dbyings kyi rang bzhin zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: nam mkha'i khams 'od gsal ba chos kyi dbyings kyi rang bzhin zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning of the element of space is the nature of the dharmadhƒÅtu.

original: de nyid kyi phyir lnga po rnams kyis zhes pa me long lta bu la sogs pa ye shes lnga po rnams kyis yongs su thams cad nas bskor zhing khyab par gyur pa'o //üîΩbde bar gyur pa nam mkha'i khams //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir lnga po rnams kyis zhes pa me long lta bu la sogs pa ye shes lnga po rnams kyis yongs su thams cad nas bskor zhing khyab par gyur pa'o // bde bar gyur pa nam mkha'i khams //
translated: Therefore, ‚Äúthe five‚Äù means that the five pristine consciousnesses, such as the mirror-like pristine consciousness, completely surround and pervade.üîΩThe state of bliss is the element of space.

original: zhes pa bde bar gyur pa ni nam mkha'i khams kyi rang bzhin nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: zhes pa bde bar gyur pa ni nam mkha'i khams kyi rang bzhin nyid kyi phyir /
translated: The state of bliss is the nature of the element of space.

original: de yang / de kho na ma yin no zhes gsungs pa /
analyzed: de yang / de kho na ma yin no zhes gsungs pa /
translated: Therefore, it is said, ‚ÄúIt is not that reality.‚Äù

original: gang phyir 'byung ba che bde ba //
analyzed: gang phyir 'byung ba che bde ba //
translated: Since the great elements are bliss,

original: de phyir bde ba de nyid min //
analyzed: de phyir bde ba de nyid min //
translated: that bliss is not reality.

original: 'byung ba chen po'i rang bzhin nyid las bde bar gyur pa'i bde ba yang dag par rig pa yang de kho na ma yin no //
analyzed: 'byung ba chen po'i rang bzhin nyid las bde bar gyur pa'i bde ba yang dag par rig pa yang de kho na ma yin no //
translated: The bliss that arises from the nature of the great elements is not the true bliss that is known.

original: 'o na / de ji ltar lhan cig skyes pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na / de ji ltar lhan cig skyes pa yin zhe na /
translated: Then, how is it coemergent?üîΩIt is stated:

original: gsungs pa / lhan cig dag las gang skyes pa //
analyzed: gsungs pa / lhan cig dag las gang skyes pa //
translated: That which arises from the two coemergent

original: lhan cig skyes par de brjod bya //
analyzed: lhan cig skyes par de brjod bya //
translated: is said to be coemergent.

original: lhan skyes dga' las zhes pa khu ba dang bde ba dag las gang skyes pa gang yin pa de ni lhan cig skyes pa'i rang bzhin yang dag pa de kho na bden par blta ste /
analyzed: lhan skyes dga' las zhes pa khu ba dang bde ba dag las gang skyes pa gang yin pa de ni lhan cig skyes pa'i rang bzhin yang dag pa de kho na bden par blta ste /
translated: That which arises from the coemergent joy, that is, from the semen and bliss, is seen to be the true nature of the coemergent, the true reality.

original: yang dag pa'i ye shes zhes brjod do //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i ye shes zhes brjod do //
translated: It is called ‚Äútrue wisdom.‚Äù

original: de nyid mngon par gsal bar byed pa /
analyzed: de nyid mngon par gsal bar byed pa /
translated: That itself is clarified:

original: rang bzhin lhan cig skyes zhes brjod //üîΩrnam pa thams cad gcig sdom pa //
analyzed: rang bzhin lhan cig skyes zhes brjod // rnam pa thams cad gcig sdom pa //
translated: The nature is said to be coemergent.

original: rang gi ngo bo ni rang bzhin te /
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo ni rang bzhin te /
translated: The essence is the nature.

original: bdag nyid rig pa lhan cig skyes pa zhes brjod do //
analyzed: bdag nyid rig pa lhan cig skyes pa zhes brjod do //
translated: It is called ‚Äúcoemergent self-awareness.‚Äù

original: de yang / rnam pa thams cad gcig sdom pa gnyis su med pa'i ngo bos yang dag par bsdus pa'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: de yang / rnam pa thams cad gcig sdom pa gnyis su med pa'i ngo bos yang dag par bsdus pa'i phyir ro ;
translated: all aspects are perfectly included in the essence of nondual union.

original: / yang na /
analyzed: / yang na /
translated: Or,üîΩüîΩ

original: sva sems dang dngos po yul dang dbang po ste /
analyzed: sva sems dang dngos po yul dang dbang po ste /
translated: svƒÅ is mind, entity, object, and sense faculty.

original: gsum po 'di ni rang bzhin ma ni lhan cig skyes pa zhes brjod do //
analyzed: gsum po 'di ni rang bzhin ma ni lhan cig skyes pa zhes brjod do //
translated: These three are said to be connate.

original: thams cad ni rdo rje 'chang ngo //
analyzed: thams cad ni rdo rje 'chang ngo //
translated: All is Vajradhara.

original: aa bdag med ma ste /üîΩsarba zhes pa'o //üîΩgnyis ka'i rnam pa bya ba ste /
analyzed: aa bdag med ma ste / sarba zhes pa'o // gnyis ka'i rnam pa bya ba ste /
translated: A is NairƒÅtmya.üîΩSarva is both.

original: rnam pa thams cad do //üîΩde yang gcig gnyis su med pa ste ;
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad do // de yang gcig gnyis su med pa ste ;
translated: The action is the aspect.

original: rnam pa thams cad gcig pa'o //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad gcig pa'o //
translated: All aspects are one.

original: de ltar gyur pa'i ye shes te rnam pa thams cad gcig pa'i ye shes so //
analyzed: de ltar gyur pa'i ye shes te rnam pa thams cad gcig pa'i ye shes so //
translated: That is the gnosis, the gnosis of the one in all aspects.

original: 'di nyid ni wa ra zhes pa mchog go //
analyzed: 'di nyid ni wa ra zhes pa mchog go //

original: 'di lta bur gyur pa'i ye shes de ni mchog go //
analyzed: 'di lta bur gyur pa'i ye shes de ni mchog go //

original: 'di nyid ni @186b lhan cig skyes pa yang dag pa'i ye shes so //
analyzed: 'di nyid ni @186b lhan cig skyes pa yang dag pa'i ye shes so //

original: gang yang gang zhig bde ba nyams su myong ba'i ye shes yang dag par 'dod pa de yang nyan thos mu stegs pa rnams zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gang yang gang zhig bde ba nyams su myong ba'i ye shes yang dag par 'dod pa de yang nyan thos mu stegs pa rnams zhes bya'o //
translated: And also, whoever truly desires the wisdom of the experience of bliss is called a ≈õrƒÅvaka tƒ´rthika.üîΩTherefore,

original: de'i phyir / phyag rgya rgyu dang bral ba las //
analyzed: de'i phyir / phyag rgya rgyu dang bral ba las //

original: yo g'i snying rje thabs su 'gyur //
analyzed: yo g'i snying rje thabs su 'gyur //

original: rnal 'byor pa zhes pa shes rab dang thabs dbyer med pa bden pa gnyis kyi bdag nyid do //
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa zhes pa shes rab dang thabs dbyer med pa bden pa gnyis kyi bdag nyid do //
translated: The yogin is the indivisibility of wisdom and means, the nature of the two truths.

original: ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is he like?

original: snying rje thabs su 'gyur /üîΩgang zhig snying rje nyid thabs te //
analyzed: snying rje thabs su 'gyur / gang zhig snying rje nyid thabs te //
translated: Compassion becomes the means.üîΩCompassion itself is the means.

original: gzhan gyi don gyi spyod pa la 'jug pa de ni snying rje thabs so //
analyzed: gzhan gyi don gyi spyod pa la 'jug pa de ni snying rje thabs so //

original: phyag rgya zhes pa shes rab ste //
analyzed: phyag rgya zhes pa shes rab ste //

original: rgyu dang bral zhes pa mtshan ma med pa'i spyod pas rnam par gnas pa'i phyir zhes dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: rgyu dang bral zhes pa mtshan ma med pa'i spyod pas rnam par gnas pa'i phyir zhes dgongs pa'o //
translated: Free of cause means that because of the conduct free of signs, one abides in the transcendent state.

analyzed: 'dis ni shes rab dang thabs kyi bdag nyid can rnal 'byor bar 'gyur ro zhes pa ste /

original: bskyed pa'i rim pa mtshon pa'o //
analyzed: bskyed pa'i rim pa mtshon pa'o //
translated: This illustrates the creation stage.

original: yang na / yo g'i snying rje thabs su 'gyur //
analyzed: yang na / yo g'i snying rje thabs su 'gyur //

original: zhes pa brtse ba ni snying rje ste /
analyzed: zhes pa brtse ba ni snying rje ste /

original: sdug bsngal dang sdug bsngal gyi rgyu las yang dag par 'don pa nyid do //
analyzed: sdug bsngal dang sdug bsngal gyi rgyu las yang dag par 'don pa nyid do //

analyzed: de nyid ni thabs te gang gi rgyu yin pa de yo g'i snying rje thabs so //
translated: That itself is the means, and that is the yogin's compassionate means.

original: phyag rgyar 'gyur te /
analyzed: phyag rgyar 'gyur te /
translated: It is the seal,

original: phyag rgya chen po'i dngos grub tu 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phyag rgya chen po'i dngos grub tu 'gyur ro //
translated: the attainment of the great seal.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How so?

original: rgyu dang bral ba las mtshan ma med pa'i spyod pas rnam par gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu dang bral ba las mtshan ma med pa'i spyod pas rnam par gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of the practice of signlessness, which is free from cause.

original: 'dis ci gsungs na kye'i rdo rje'i rnal 'byor pa de ltar gyur pa de ni sems can thams cad grol bar byed pa yin gyi /
analyzed: 'dis ci gsungs na kye'i rdo rje'i rnal 'byor pa de ltar gyur pa de ni sems can thams cad grol bar byed pa yin gyi /

original: sems can kyi ming can ni ma yin te /
analyzed: sems can kyi ming can ni ma yin te /
translated: But one who is not such is not even called a sentient being.

original: 'di ltar ni thabs la mkhas pa nyid do zhes pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar ni thabs la mkhas pa nyid do zhes pa'o //

original: kye'i rdo rje'i rnal 'byor pa de ltar mchog tu thabs la mkhas pa de yang gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir rdzogs pa'i rim pas sdud pa gsungs pa /
analyzed: kye'i rdo rje'i rnal 'byor pa de ltar mchog tu thabs la mkhas pa de yang gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir rdzogs pa'i rim pas sdud pa gsungs pa /

original: stong nyid snying rje dbyer med pa //
analyzed: stong nyid snying rje dbyer med pa //

original: byang chub sems zhes dran pa'o ;
analyzed: byang chub sems zhes dran pa'o ;

original: / stong pa nyid ni de bzhin nyid do //
analyzed: / stong pa nyid ni de bzhin nyid do //

original: snying rje ni sems so //
analyzed: snying rje ni sems so //

analyzed: stong pa nyid dang snying rje de nyid dbyer med pa ste / stong pa nyid gang yin pa de ni snying rje'o //

analyzed: snying rje gang yin pa de ni stong pa nyid de /

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis gang gsungs pa /üîΩsems kha na da bzhin nyid do //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis gang gsungs pa / sems kha na da bzhin nyid do //

original: de bzhin nyid kho na sems so //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid kho na sems so //

analyzed: de nyid byang chub kyi sems rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes zhes dran te /
translated: That is called the non-conceptual wisdom of the mind of enlightenment.

original: dran pa ma nyams pa'i rnal 'byor gyis gnas pa bla ma dam pa'i zhabs las thob pa zhes pa'i don te /üîΩlhan cig skyes pa ni de lta bu'i rang bzhin @187a * //
analyzed: dran pa ma nyams pa'i rnal 'byor gyis gnas pa bla ma dam pa'i zhabs las thob pa zhes pa'i don te / lhan cig skyes pa ni de lta bu'i rang bzhin @187a * //

original: gyi phyir ro //
analyzed: gyi phyir ro //

original: sngags kyi bzlas med dka' thub med cing sbyin sreg med //
analyzed: sngags kyi bzlas med dka' thub med cing sbyin sreg med //

original: dkyil 'khor can yang med cing dkyil 'khor yang med de /
analyzed: dkyil 'khor can yang med cing dkyil 'khor yang med de /

analyzed: de ni sngags bzlas de dka' thub dang de spyin sreg / de ni dkyil 'khor can dang de ni dkyil 'khor nyid //
translated: That is the mantra recitation, that is the austerity, that is the fire sacrifice, that is the mandala-possessor, and that is the mandala itself.

original: mdor bsdus pa ni sems su 'dus pa'i gzugs can no //
analyzed: mdor bsdus pa ni sems su 'dus pa'i gzugs can no //
translated: In brief, it is included in the mind, which has the form of a collection.

analyzed: de kho na shes pa rnams kyi sngags par mi bya'o //

analyzed: dka' thub mi bya'o //

original: sbyin sreg mi bya'o //
analyzed: sbyin sreg mi bya'o //

analyzed: lha ma lus pa yang bsgom par mi bya'o //

analyzed: ji ltar zhe na gang gi phyir de nyid de'i sngags bzlas pa ste /

analyzed: de nyid dka' thub bo //

original: de nyid sbyin sreg go //
analyzed: de nyid sbyin sreg go //

analyzed: de nyid dkyil 'khor can lha'i gzugs so //
translated: that itself is the deity form with the ma·πá·∏çala,

original: de nyid dkyil 'khor te /
analyzed: de nyid dkyil 'khor te /
translated: that itself is the ma·πá·∏çala,

analyzed: mdor bsdus pa ni bsdus pa dang sdom pa dang / dbyer med ba'i phyir sems su 'dus pa'i gzugs can 'dus pa ni tshogs pa'o //

original: sems de nyid 'dus pa yang ste /
analyzed: sems de nyid 'dus pa yang ste /

analyzed: mos pa sna tshogs rgyu nyid de //

analyzed: sems kyi rdo rje rnam grol na //

analyzed: lha gzhan med par mngon par brjod //

original: ces pa'i gsungs las so ;

analyzed: spyin sreg med ces pa 'dis thugs rdo rje dbye ba med pa'o //

translated: The statement ‚Äúno mandala‚Äù refers to the indivisibility of the wisdom.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /

analyzed: mdor bsdus pa ni mnyam pa dbyer med pa nyid /

analyzed: de'i nang du sems kyang thim pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: rdo rje 'chang d'i yi rang bzhin de lta bu yin pa'i phyir sems ni 'dus pa'i gzugs can te /

analyzed: gang zhig sems ni 'dus pa'i gzugs can de ni sems las 'das pa rang byung ba'o //

analyzed: dkyil 'khor dang dkyil 'khor can nyid kyis de nyid gnyis ka snyoms par 'jug pa'o //
translated: That is both the ma·πá·∏çala and the ma·πá·∏çalƒÅdhƒÅra, the union.

original: bzlas pa dang / dka' thub dang / spyin sreg gi rang bzhin nyid kyis rdo rje gsum gyi rang bzhin no //
analyzed: bzlas pa dang / dka' thub dang / spyin sreg gi rang bzhin nyid kyis rdo rje gsum gyi rang bzhin no //
translated: Since it is the nature of repetition, austerity, and fire sacrifice, it is the nature of the three vajras.

original: thams cad bsdus pa'i bdag nyid kyis ye shes lnga dang sku gsum dang shes rab dang thabs kyi bdag nyid rdo rje 'chang rang byung ba kho na zhes pa'o //
analyzed: thams cad bsdus pa'i bdag nyid kyis ye shes lnga dang sku gsum dang shes rab dang thabs kyi bdag nyid rdo rje 'chang rang byung ba kho na zhes pa'o //
translated: Since it is the nature of the collection of all, it is the nature of the five gnoses, the three kƒÅyas, wisdom, and method, self-arisen Vajradhara.

original: mngon par dbang bskur ba'i le'u ste bcu pa'o //
analyzed: mngon par dbang bskur ba'i le'u ste bcu pa'o //
translated: This is the tenth chapter on the abhi·π£eka.

analyzed: gnyis ka rnam par dag pa ni mngon par dbang bskur ba'o //

original: de yang pa ta sbas pa ste /
analyzed: de yang pa ta sbas pa ste /

analyzed: de len pa'i phyir mngon par dbang bskur ba'i le'u'o //

analyzed: bcu pa zhes pa bcu rnams kyis rdzogs pa ni bcu pa ste /

analyzed: yang na gang dkyil 'khor du mngon bar dbang bskur ba'i le'u yin pas na /
translated: Or, since it is the consecration chapter in the mandala,üîΩit is the consecration in the mandala, the tenth chapter.

original: // / da ni dbang bskur ba las de kho na shes pa las sems can gzhug pa'i chad du lta stangs bzhi mngon du gyur pa'i phyir le'u dang por mdor bstan pa'i lta stangs dgug pa la sogs pa'i nus pa rgyas par bshad pa gsungs pa /

translated: Now, in order to introduce sentient beings to the knowledge of reality from the consecration, the four gazes are manifested, so the power of the nine gazes such as summoning, which were taught in brief in the first chapter, is explained in detail.

original: mnyam pa drag po dpral pa can //
analyzed: mnyam pa drag po dpral pa can //

analyzed: rtag tu ltung bar byed par brjod //

analyzed: drag po zhes ba drag bo'i las byed pa'o // dpral ba can zhes pa /
translated: Fierce means performing fierce actions.üîΩFrontal meansüîΩthe frontal door.

analyzed: dpral bar gnas pa'i sgo yis ltung bar byed ces pa ltung bar bya ba'i sgo yis gsad pa'i lta stangs gsungs pa /

original: rtag tu zhes pa /
analyzed: rtag tu zhes pa /
translated: Always means

original: rtag par rgyun du goms pa yis //
analyzed: rtag par rgyun du goms pa yis //
translated: always, through constant practice.

original: zhes pa ste /
analyzed: zhes pa ste /

analyzed: thams cad la sbyar bar bya'o //

analyzed: dbang gi lta stangs g-yon na gnas //

analyzed: dbang ni dbang du sdud pa ste //

analyzed: dbang du byed pa'i sgo yis g-yon na gnas /

translated: the hero is the pristine consciousness of the indivisibility of the three existences.

original: aa bdag med ma dang / ba rdo rje 'chang ngo //üîΩaa pa gnyis ka dbyer med pa nges par gzhug cing khyab par bya ste /
analyzed: aa bdag med ma dang / ba rdo rje 'chang ngo // aa pa gnyis ka dbyer med pa nges par gzhug cing khyab par bya ste /
translated: A is Nairatmya, and va is Vajradhara.üîΩThe two, A and va, are inseparable, and one should enter and pervade with that.

original: gnyis ka dbyer med par spro ba nyid ces pa'o //
analyzed: gnyis ka dbyer med par spro ba nyid ces pa'o //
translated: The meaning is that one should emanate the inseparable two.

original: mkhas ba zhes pa ye shes gcig pu'i rang bzhin zhes pa'i don no //
analyzed: mkhas ba zhes pa ye shes gcig pu'i rang bzhin zhes pa'i don no //
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúthe wise‚Äù is ‚Äúthe nature of the single gnosis.‚Äù

original: gal te lta stangs bzhi la lta stangs gsum ni sems can 'jug pa la don yod kyi /
analyzed: gal te lta stangs bzhi la lta stangs gsum ni sems can 'jug pa la don yod kyi /
translated: If one asks, ‚ÄúAmong the four gazes, the three gazes are meaningful for engaging sentient beings,

original: gsad pa'i lta stangs ni re zhig @189b sems can 'jug pa la ring bar gyur te /
analyzed: gsad pa'i lta stangs ni re zhig @189b sems can 'jug pa la ring bar gyur te /
translated: but the gaze of killing is distant for engaging sentient beings for a while,

original: sems can la gnod pa kho nar 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: sems can la gnod pa kho nar 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: because it only harms sentient beings,‚Äù

original: de'i phyir gsungs pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir gsungs pa /
translated: then the reply is this:

original: gsad pas 'dir ni 'bras med 'gyur //
analyzed: gsad pas 'dir ni 'bras med 'gyur //
translated: ‚ÄúKilling is fruitless here,

original: gzhan du dam tshig nyams par 'gyur //
analyzed: gzhan du dam tshig nyams par 'gyur //
translated: and elsewhere, one‚Äôs pledge is damaged.‚Äù

original: gsad pa la ni 'bras bu ci yang med kyi khyad par du skyon nyid nye bar skye bar 'gyur te //
analyzed: gsad pa la ni 'bras bu ci yang med kyi khyad par du skyon nyid nye bar skye bar 'gyur te //
translated: Killing is fruitless in every way, and in particular, only a fault arises.

original: dam tshig nyams pa zhes pa sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa'i gsung rab la goms par gyur pa nyid do //
analyzed: dam tshig nyams pa zhes pa sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa'i gsung rab la goms par gyur pa nyid do //
translated: The so-called violation of the vow is the very habituation to the scriptures of the Buddhas and Bodhisattvas.

original: brdzun smra ba la sogs pa gzhan yang 'gog par byed na gsod pa ni mchog tu yang ngo zhe na /
analyzed: brdzun smra ba la sogs pa gzhan yang 'gog par byed na gsod pa ni mchog tu yang ngo zhe na /
translated: If one were to stop others from lying, etc., how much more so from killing?

original: de'i phyir gsungs pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir gsungs pa /
translated: Therefore it is said:

original: sems can slu ba spangs nas ni //
analyzed: sems can slu ba spangs nas ni //
translated: Having abandoned the deception of sentient beings,

original: bya ba ma yin thams cad bya //
analyzed: bya ba ma yin thams cad bya //
translated: one should do everything that is not to be done.

original: srog bcad pas thams cad du mi dge ba skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: srog bcad pas thams cad du mi dge ba skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: By killing, one always generates demerit.

original: brdzun la sogs pa rnams la thams cad du mi dge ba med pa'i phyir sems can la gnod pa mi dge bas skyon cing 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: brdzun la sogs pa rnams la thams cad du mi dge ba med pa'i phyir sems can la gnod pa mi dge bas skyon cing 'gyur zhe na /
translated: Since there is no demerit in lying, etc., how can one be defiled by the demerit of harming sentient beings?üîΩ It is said:

original: gsungs pa / sems can gnod pa tsam gyis ni //
analyzed: gsungs pa / sems can gnod pa tsam gyis ni //
translated: By merely harming sentient beings,

original: phyag rgya'i dngos grub rnyed mi 'gyur //
analyzed: phyag rgya'i dngos grub rnyed mi 'gyur //
translated: one will not attain the power of the seal.

original: zhes pa gang gi phyir sems can re re la gnod pa nyid kyis phyag rgya chen po'i dngos grub nyams so zhes pa'i don no //
analyzed: zhes pa gang gi phyir sems can re re la gnod pa nyid kyis phyag rgya chen po'i dngos grub nyams so zhes pa'i don no //
translated: Since the power of the great seal is lost by merely harming each sentient being, this is the meaning of the verse.

original: 'dis ni gsad pa zhes bya ba 'di mi bya ba kho na'o //
analyzed: 'dis ni gsad pa zhes bya ba 'di mi bya ba kho na'o //
translated: This is what is meant by the statement, ‚ÄúOne should not do what is called ‚Äòkilling.‚Äô ‚Äù

original: de ltar na 'di goms par byed pa de ci'i don du gsungs she na /
analyzed: de ltar na 'di goms par byed pa de ci'i don du gsungs she na /
translated: For what purpose is this practice taught?

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid 'grub pa la thams cad goms par bya ba kho na'o //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid 'grub pa la thams cad goms par bya ba kho na'o //
translated: It is taught for the sake of the accomplishment of omniscience, which is the practice of everything.

original: 'on kyang dor ba nyid kyis rnam par gnas par bya'o zhes dgongs te /
analyzed: 'on kyang dor ba nyid kyis rnam par gnas par bya'o zhes dgongs te /
translated: However, one should remain in the practice by means of the very relinquishment.

original: ji ltar bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub thob par 'dod pa des /
analyzed: ji ltar bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub thob par 'dod pa des /
translated: Just as one who desires to attain unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment

original: nyan thos la sogs pa'i sa la yang bslab pa nyid de /
analyzed: nyan thos la sogs pa'i sa la yang bslab pa nyid de /
translated: should train in the stages of the ≈õrƒÅvakas, etc.

original: ci de'i sems nyan thos kyi sa la gnas par bya'o snyam pa ni ma yin te spangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ci de'i sems nyan thos kyi sa la gnas par bya'o snyam pa ni ma yin te spangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: But it is not that one should abide in the mind of the ≈õrƒÅvaka stage, because that has been relinquished.

original: de nyid kyi phyir rlon pa'i shing la goms par bya'o zhes pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir rlon pa'i shing la goms par bya'o zhes pa'o //
translated: For this very reason, it is said, ‚ÄúOne should practice with a moist log.‚Äù

original: yang na gang gsad par gsungs pa gang yin pa de sems can la gnod pa'i blos bya ba ma yin gyi 'on kyang phan pa'i bsam pa kho nas bya'o //
analyzed: yang na gang gsad par gsungs pa gang yin pa de sems can la gnod pa'i blos bya ba ma yin gyi 'on kyang phan pa'i bsam pa kho nas bya'o //
translated: Or, that which is said to be killing should not be done with a mind that harms sentient beings, but rather it should be done with the intention to benefit.

original: de lta mod kyi dkon mchog gsum la sogs pa la /üîΩgnod pa'i bsam pas zhugs pa dmyal par 'gro bar 'gyur ba'i sems can de kho na rtogs pas snying rje'i bsam pa nyid dang de la phan pa'i blos mi bskyod pa'i rigs la bsad nas drang bar bya ba yin gyi gzhan khro bas zil gyis mnan pa la
analyzed: de lta mod kyi dkon mchog gsum la sogs pa la / gnod pa'i bsam pas zhugs pa dmyal par 'gro bar 'gyur ba'i sems can de kho na rtogs pas snying rje'i bsam pa nyid dang de la phan pa'i blos mi bskyod pa'i rigs la bsad nas drang bar bya ba yin gyi gzhan khro bas zil gyis mnan pa la
translated: Still, those who harm the three jewels and so on are sentient beings who will go to hell.üîΩTherefore, with the intention of compassion, you should kill them with the intention of benefiting them and lead them to the family of Ak·π£obhya.üîΩ

original: sogs pa rnams kyi gnod pa'i bsam pas ma yin no zhes pa'i don no //üîΩyang na / gsad pas 'dir ni 'bras bur 'gyur //
analyzed: sogs pa rnams kyi gnod pa'i bsam pas ma yin no zhes pa'i don no // yang na / gsad pas 'dir ni 'bras bur 'gyur //
translated: Still, one should kill those sentient beings who are intent on harming the Three Jewels and so on, and lead them to the state of a non-regressing spiritual family, with the intention of compassion and the thought to benefit them, and not with the intention to harm others, such as through being overcome by anger.üîΩThis is the meaning.

original: bsad pas zhes @190a * //
analyzed: bsad pas zhes @190a * //
translated: Or else, the result is here by killing.

original: pa dbang po dang yul dang rnam par shes pa rnams gsad pa las 'bras bu yang dag pa'i ye shes 'grub bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: pa dbang po dang yul dang rnam par shes pa rnams gsad pa las 'bras bu yang dag pa'i ye shes 'grub bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The result of authentic gnosis is accomplished by killing the sense faculties, objects, and consciousnesses.

original: de nyid kyi phyir 'dus pa'i khyad par te /üîΩ'dus pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa lha rnams 'dus pa ste /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir 'dus pa'i khyad par te / 'dus pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa lha rnams 'dus pa ste /

original: 'di la lha rnams 'dus pa'i phyir 'dus pa'o //
analyzed: 'di la lha rnams 'dus pa'i phyir 'dus pa'o //

analyzed: de'i khyad par ni lha rnams 'dus pa'i rnam par rtog pa yang de la med do zhes pa ste /

analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir mchog rmad du byung ba 'grub par 'gyur te /

analyzed: nyan thos la sogs pa'i spyod yul ma yin pa'i phyir ro /
translated: because it is not the domain of the ≈õrƒÅvakas, etc.

original: de nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir /

analyzed: bya ba ma yin thams cad bya //

original: thams cad ni rdo rje 'chang ngo //
analyzed: thams cad ni rdo rje 'chang ngo //

original: aa bdag med ma ste /
analyzed: aa bdag med ma ste /

original: sarba zhes pa'o //
analyzed: sarba zhes pa'o //

original: 'di gnyis ka dbyer med pa ni bya ba ste /
analyzed: 'di gnyis ka dbyer med pa ni bya ba ste /

original: 'bras bu nyid do //
analyzed: 'bras bu nyid do //

analyzed: de gsungs pa /

analyzed: bya ba de yongs su spangs nas zhes pa bya ba dang bral ba'i phyir zhes dgongs pa'o //

original: de nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir /
translated: For that very reason,

translated: merely by harming sentient beings.

analyzed: sems can gnod pa'i sgras srid pa gsum gcig pa nyid rtogs pa med par rtogs pas phyag rgya'i dngos grub /
translated: The power of the seal is the realization of the sameness of the three worlds by the realization that there is no realization without the sound of harming sentient beings.

original: phyag rgya chen po'i dngos grub ste /
analyzed: phyag rgya chen po'i dngos grub ste /
translated: The power of the great seal is

original: de nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir /

analyzed: de ni zos pa tsam gyis ni /

original: skad cig de la mkha' spyod 'gyur //
analyzed: skad cig de la mkha' spyod 'gyur //

original: mkha' la spyod pa nyid thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mkha' la spyod pa nyid thob par 'gyur ro //

analyzed: 'dis ni de yang mkha' la spyod pa 'grub par zhes dgongs pa'o // yang na gang lan bdun pa de'i sha zos pas des mkha' spyad 'gyur te /
translated: This means that by eating the flesh of the seven-times-at-most one, one also accomplishes the state of being a sky-goer.
Or, by eating the flesh of one who is seven times at most, one becomes a sky-goer.

original: la spyod pa'i dngos grub 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: la spyod pa'i dngos grub 'byung bar 'gyur ro //

original: skad cig las zhes pa de'i skad cig las te /
analyzed: skad cig las zhes pa de'i skad cig las te /

analyzed: dus gzhan gyis bar du chod ba med do zhes pa'i don no //

analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir de ni 'grub bar 'gyur te / dga' ba la dga' ba la smod pa //

analyzed: dga' bral gyi dga' bas gang zhig 'grub pa de la smod pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: 'dis ni dga' bral gyi dga' ba'i ye shes kyis mkha' la spyod pa 'grub par 'gyur ro zhes pa'i don no //

analyzed: yang na lan bdun pa zhes pa shes rab dang thabs dbyer med pa yang dang yang bzlas shing goms pa ste /

analyzed: de na drug pa kho na bdun pa nyid do zhes pa lan bdun pa'o //

analyzed: gcig gnyis su med pa'i do bos mtshon par gyur pa ni rgyal po sems kyi rdo rje dbang du byed par 'gyur ro //

original: phul du byung bas skyes pa'i phyir rab skye'o //
analyzed: phul du byung bas skyes pa'i phyir rab skye'o //
translated: Since it is born as the best, it is supremely born.

original: 'jig rten ni phung po lnga ste /
analyzed: 'jig rten ni phung po lnga ste /
translated: The world is the five aggregates.

original: rab skye dang 'jig rten ni skye dgu 'jig rten no //
analyzed: rab skye dang 'jig rten ni skye dgu 'jig rten no //
translated: The supremely born and the world are the world of living beings.

original: khri yis bdag med ma rab tu rtogs pa las zhes dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: khri yis bdag med ma rab tu rtogs pa las zhes dgongs pa'o //
translated: By the throne, one realizes Nairatmya is the intended meaning.

original: phyugs kyi sgras dbang po rnams so //
analyzed: phyugs kyi sgras dbang po rnams so //
translated: The word cattle refers to the senses.

original: 'dab chags kyi sgras shes rab dang thabs so //
analyzed: 'dab chags kyi sgras shes rab dang thabs so //
translated: The word birds refers to wisdom and means.

original: dang po ni sems te /
analyzed: dang po ni sems te /
translated: The first is the mind.

original: @192b phyugs dang 'dab chags sogs dbang po dang yul gyi bdag nyid can shes rab dang thabs dbyer med pa'i sems so //
analyzed: @192b phyugs dang 'dab chags sogs dbang po dang yul gyi bdag nyid can shes rab dang thabs dbyer med pa'i sems so //
translated: Cattle, birds, etc. are the mind of indivisible wisdom and means, which is the nature of the senses and objects.

original: bye ba ni phul du byung ba rtogs pa'i phyir zhes pa'i don no //
analyzed: bye ba ni phul du byung ba rtogs pa'i phyir zhes pa'i don no //
translated: The word billions means because of realization of the best.

original: aa bdag med ma dang / su khu ba byang chub kyi sems te /
analyzed: aa bdag med ma dang / su khu ba byang chub kyi sems te /
translated: A is Nairatmya, and su is the bodhicitta.

original: aa su'o // de 'dor zhing spong ba'i phyir /
analyzed: aa su'o // de 'dor zhing spong ba'i phyir /
translated: Since one abandons and rejects that,

original: de rnams lha ma yin te /
analyzed: de rnams lha ma yin te /
translated: they are the demigods.

original: 'bum phrag bdun gyis zhes pa drug pa rdo rje 'chang las 'das pa'i ye shes kyis zhes pa'i don no //
analyzed: 'bum phrag bdun gyis zhes pa drug pa rdo rje 'chang las 'das pa'i ye shes kyis zhes pa'i don no //
translated: The seven hundred thousand means the pristine consciousness that transcends the sixth stage of Vajradhara.

original: 'bum phrag gnyis kyis lha rnams te //
analyzed: 'bum phrag gnyis kyis lha rnams te //
translated: The two hundred thousand are the deities.

original: rol pa'i phyir lha ye shes lnga la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rol pa'i phyir lha ye shes lnga la sogs pa'o //
translated: In order to play, the deities are the five pristine consciousnesses, and so on.

original: de rnams gnyis su mtshon pas shes rab dang thabs kyi rang bzhin gyis so //
analyzed: de rnams gnyis su mtshon pas shes rab dang thabs kyi rang bzhin gyis so //
translated: Since those are symbolized as two, they are the nature of wisdom and method.

original: brgya phrag gcig gis sngags pa'o //
analyzed: brgya phrag gcig gis sngags pa'o //
translated: The one hundred are the mantras.

original: 'di rnams la sngags yod pa'i phyir sngags pa sku gsung thugs rnams so //
analyzed: 'di rnams la sngags yod pa'i phyir sngags pa sku gsung thugs rnams so //
translated: Since they exist in those, the mantras are body, speech, and mind.

original: gcig gis zhes pa ae chos 'byung gi bdag nyid dang / kas ye shes te /
analyzed: gcig gis zhes pa ae chos 'byung gi bdag nyid dang / kas ye shes te /
translated: The one is the nature of the e of the phenomena source and the k of pristine consciousness.

original: chos 'byung gi ye shes kyis so //
analyzed: chos 'byung gi ye shes kyis so //
translated: The phenomena source is the pristine consciousness.

original: khyad par cis she na brgya yis te //üîΩspro ba'i tshul gyis zhes pa'i don no //
analyzed: khyad par cis she na brgya yis te // spro ba'i tshul gyis zhes pa'i don no //
translated: By what is it distinguished? By the hundred.

original: kun rdzob kyi bden pas ni //
analyzed: kun rdzob kyi bden pas ni //
translated: The meaning of in the manner of emanation is the relative truth.

original: sems can thams cad dbang byed pa //
analyzed: sems can thams cad dbang byed pa //

original: ku ru kulle'i sgrub thabs bshad //
analyzed: ku ru kulle'i sgrub thabs bshad //
translated: The siddhi of Kurukulla is explained.

original: de nyid gsungs pas bon hr'i: yig kha dog dmar po'o //
analyzed: de nyid gsungs pas bon hr'i: yig kha dog dmar po'o //
translated: The BhagavƒÅn said, The seed syllable is the red letter hrƒ´·∏•.

original: de las skyes pa'i lha mo ste /
analyzed: de las skyes pa'i lha mo ste /
translated: The goddess born from that

original: de yang kha dog dmar mo phyag bzhi ma /
analyzed: de yang kha dog dmar mo phyag bzhi ma /
translated: is also red, with four faces.

original: phyag bzhi po rnams kyi g-yon pa'i phyag dang po na gzhu'o //
analyzed: phyag bzhi po rnams kyi g-yon pa'i phyag dang po na gzhu'o //
translated: In the first left hand of the four-faced one is a bow.

original: gnyis pa na autpala'o //
analyzed: gnyis pa na autpala'o //

original: g-yas pa'i phyag dang po na mda'o //
analyzed: g-yas pa'i phyag dang po na mda'o //

original: gnyis pa na lcags kyu'o //
analyzed: gnyis pa na lcags kyu'o //

analyzed: de lta bu'i rim pas 'di bsgoms pa tsam gyis 'jig rten gsum po dbang du byed cing /
translated: By merely meditating on her in this way, one subjugates the three worlds.

original: sngags bzlas pas kyang ste /
analyzed: sngags bzlas pas kyang ste /
translated: By reciting the mantra,

original: 'bum phrag gcig gis rgyal po dbang du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'bum phrag gcig gis rgyal po dbang du 'gyur ro //
translated: one subjugates a king with one hundred thousand recitations.

original: stong phrag bcus skye dgu 'jig rten pa'o //
analyzed: stong phrag bcus skye dgu 'jig rten pa'o //

original: bye ba'i sngags kyis phyugs dang 'dab chags so //
analyzed: bye ba'i sngags kyis phyugs dang 'dab chags so //
translated: With ten million, one subjugates cattle and birds.

analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras yi dgas la sogs pa yang gzung bar bya'o // 'bum phrag bdung yis lha ma yi rnams so //
translated: And so on includes pretas and so forth.üîΩWith one hundred and twenty thousand, one subjugates the asuras.

original: 'bum phrag gnyis kyis lha rnams so //
analyzed: 'bum phrag gnyis kyis lha rnams so //
translated: With two hundred thousand, one subjugates the gods.

original: brgya phrag gcig gis sngags pa ste ye shes dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: brgya phrag gcig gis sngags pa ste ye shes dang ldan pa'o //
translated: With one hundred, one subjugates the mantra practitioner, the one with knowledge.

original: zhes pa rdo rje snying po mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa zhes bya ba brtag pa'i rgyal po le'u bcu gcig pa rdzogs so //
analyzed: zhes pa rdo rje snying po mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa zhes bya ba brtag pa'i rgyal po le'u bcu gcig pa rdzogs so //
